page.title: 11ST. MARTIN'S IN 1985 (3)
page.content:
St. Martin's is still a beautiful parish. Some of the fine old buildings, which had fallen into a state of disrepair have been bought, in many cases by wealthy immigrants, and restored.
This area, which lies between the picturesque harbour of Rozel and St. Catherine's breakwater, has fine cliff-top walks with outastanding views, looking towards France, just fifteen miles away. One can only hope that the parish will retain its identity and natural beauty, as well as coping with the ever-increasing demands of the fast-approaching 21st century.
